label: Senior Platform Engineer - Strong Match

job.title: Senior Platform Engineer (Cloud Platform)

Skills: TypeScript, Node.js, AWS (EKS, Lambda, Step Functions), Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker, GitHub Actions, Kafka, OpenTelemetry, Python.

job.description:
SignalSphere is building a unified observability platform for internal teams and seeks a senior engineer to own instrumentation and tooling.

Responsibilities:
- Build services in Go to collect, enrich, and route telemetry data at scale.
- Operate Prometheus, Grafana, and Tempo/Jaeger clusters with automation.
- Drive OpenTelemetry adoption across backend, mobile, and data teams.
- Partner with SRE to define SLO templates, runbooks, and incident tooling.

Required Experience:
- 6+ years in SRE, observability, or platform engineering roles.
- Hands-on with Go, Prometheus, Grafana, and tracing systems.
- Experience implementing OpenTelemetry SDKs and collectors.
- Familiarity with Terraform, Kubernetes, and service meshes.
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.
- Authorization to work in the United States.

Nice To Have:
- Exposure to analytics pipelines (Kafka, ClickHouse).
- Experience with feature flag driven rollout of instrumentation.

resume.background: Senior observability engineer scaling telemetry pipelines for SaaS platforms.
resume.content:
Summary: Observability platform engineer with 8 years experience building logging, metrics, and tracing stacks. Strong in Go, Terraform, OpenTelemetry, and SRE practices.

Experience:
- Staff Observability Engineer, CloudTrace (2020-2024): Built Go services for telemetry ingestion, rolled out OpenTelemetry collectors, managed Prometheus and Tempo clusters, established SLO program.
- SRE, AppStream (2016-2020): Managed Kubernetes monitoring, created Grafana dashboards, implemented alerting and incident automation.

Skills: Go, Python, Prometheus, Grafana, Tempo, OpenTelemetry, Terraform, Kubernetes, Istio, Kafka, Honeycomb, PagerDuty.

Education: B.S. Computer Science, UC San Diego (2014).

Work Authorization: U.S. citizen.

expectedOutcome.notes: Explanation should highlight observability leadership and note analytics pipeline exposure as growth area.

label: E-commerce Frontend Engineer - High Alignment

job.title: Senior Frontend Engineer - E-commerce Experience
job.description:
ModaBeam is replatforming our flagship storefront and needs a senior frontend engineer to lead customer-facing experiences.

Responsibilities:
- Build React and Next.js features with TypeScript and incremental static regeneration.
- Optimize Core Web Vitals, accessibility, and experimentation instrumentation.
- Implement GraphQL integrations, edge caching strategies, and design system components.
- Collaborate with product, UX, and data teams to iterate quickly on user journeys.

Required Experience:
- 7+ years building production React and TypeScript applications.
- Hands-on experience with Next.js, SSR, and image optimization.
- Knowledge of GraphQL, Apollo, and performance profiling tools.
- Experience running A/B tests and working with analytics platforms.
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.
- Authorized to work in the United States.

Nice To Have:
- Experience with headless commerce platforms (CommerceTools, Shopify Plus).
- Familiarity with WebGL or 3D merchandising.

resume.background: Senior frontend engineer focused on high-performance retail experiences.
resume.content:
Summary: Frontend engineer with 9 years delivering e-commerce experiences using React, Next.js, and GraphQL. Passionate about performance and experimentation.

Experience:
- Lead Frontend Engineer, TrendLuxe (2019-2024): Led Next.js storefront, improved Core Web Vitals by 35%, integrated Apollo GraphQL gateway, ran Optimizely experiments.
- Frontend Engineer, StylePath (2015-2019): Built React SPA, introduced design tokens, created Lighthouse performance dashboards.

Skills: React, Next.js, TypeScript, GraphQL, Apollo, Tailwind, Emotion, Lighthouse, Webpack, Optimizely, Segment, Vercel, Storybook.

Education: B.S. Computer Science, University of Arizona (2014).

Work Authorization: U.S. citizen.

expectedOutcome.notes: Expect explanation to point out strong performance focus and note optional headless commerce experience.

label: Data Privacy Platform Engineer - Compliance Gap

job.title: Senior Backend Engineer - Data Privacy Platform
job.description:
GuardianLayer builds a data privacy automation platform and needs a backend engineer to expand our compliance engine.

Responsibilities:
- Develop Go microservices handling data subject requests, policy enforcement, and audit logging.
- Design PostgreSQL schemas and Kafka pipelines to capture compliance events.
- Implement access controls, encryption workflows, and privacy automation playbooks.
- Collaborate with security and legal teams to map regulatory requirements to code.

Required Experience:
- 6+ years backend development with Go or similar languages.
- Experience with Kafka, streaming systems, and distributed systems design.
- Knowledge of privacy or security compliance frameworks (SOC 2, GDPR, CCPA).
- Familiarity with infrastructure-as-code, Kubernetes, and observability tooling.
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.
- Authorized to work in the United States.

Nice To Have:
- Experience implementing consent management or privacy impact assessments.
- Background in threat modeling or data classification.

resume.background: Senior backend engineer focused on platform services and reliability.
resume.content:
Summary: Backend engineer with 7 years building Go microservices, event-driven systems, and developer tooling. Interested in privacy and security automation.

Experience:
- Senior Engineer, TrustForge (2020-2024): Built Go services with PostgreSQL and Kafka, led Kubernetes migrations, implemented RBAC and audit trails; engaged with compliance team but not owner.
- Backend Engineer, BrightOps (2017-2020): Developed Go APIs for infrastructure automation, managed Terraform modules, introduced Prometheus monitoring.

Skills: Go, PostgreSQL, Kafka, gRPC, Kubernetes, Terraform, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Redis, Python.

Compliance Exposure: Supported SOC 2 audits and built access logging features but no direct GDPR ownership.

Education: B.S. Computer Science, Boston University (2015).

Work Authorization: U.S. citizen.

expectedOutcome.notes: Explanation should highlight strong Go platform skills and note limited direct ownership of privacy frameworks.

label: Defense Platform Engineer - Work Authorization Blocker

job.title: Lead Full Stack Engineer - Defense Platform
job.description:
Aegis Systems builds mission planning software for defense partners and seeks a lead full stack engineer with active clearance eligibility.

Responsibilities:
- Lead React and Node.js development of secure mission planning tools with GraphQL APIs.
- Implement rigorous testing, secure coding practices, and audit logging.
- Collaborate with product and defense stakeholders to deliver features on classified networks.
- Mentor engineers, drive coding standards, and oversee deployment pipelines.

Required Experience:
- 8+ years building full stack web applications (Node.js, React, GraphQL).
- Experience with FedRAMP, DISA, or similar security compliance frameworks.
- Background working on secure networks, role-based access control, and auditing.
- Ability to obtain and maintain U.S. security clearance; U.S. citizenship required.
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.
- Must be on-site in Arlington, VA three days per week.

Nice To Have:
- Prior DoD or defense contractor experience.
- Knowledge of TypeScript, Kubernetes, and secure DevOps pipelines.

resume.background: Lead full stack engineer building B2B SaaS platforms.
resume.content:
Summary: Lead engineer with 9 years building React and Node.js products for enterprise customers. Experienced with GraphQL, TypeScript, and Kubernetes.

Experience:
- Lead Engineer, SecureBridge (2019-2024): Built GraphQL APIs, led React modernization, implemented SOC 2 compliant pipelines, but requires H1B sponsorship.
- Senior Software Engineer, CloudServe (2015-2019): Delivered Node.js microservices, managed Kubernetes deployments, introduced role-based access controls.

Skills: Node.js, TypeScript, React, GraphQL, PostgreSQL, Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Jest, Cypress, SOC 2 controls.

Education: M.S. Computer Science, University of Maryland (2014).

Work Authorization: H1B visa holder; requires employer sponsorship. No security clearance.

expectedOutcome.notes: System should flag work authorization and clearance blocker despite strong technical alignment.
